name: Quotient Rule for Derivatives
explanation: The quotient rule finds the derivative of a quotient (division) of two functions. The formula is: derivative of top times bottom, minus top times derivative of bottom, all divided by bottom squared. Remember: 'low d-high minus high d-low, over low squared' helps memorize this rule.

examples.problem: Find the derivative of f(x) = x²/(x + 1)

proof: For f(x) = u(x)/v(x), rewrite as f(x) = u(x)[v(x)]^(-1). Apply product rule: f'(x) = u'(x)[v(x)]^(-1) + u(x)(-1)[v(x)]^(-2)v'(x) = u'(x)/v(x) - u(x)v'(x)/[v(x)]². Common denominator: = [u'(x)v(x) - u(x)v'(x)]/[v(x)]².
